meanings.definition: Causing or promoting the development of atherosclerosis.
meanings.sent1: The atherogenic diet led to clogged arteries in the mice.
meanings.sent2: Doctors warn against consuming atherogenic foods for heart health.
meanings.sent3: The atherogenic cake recipe was a hit at the party, but not for the arteries.
meanings.sent4: Her atherogenic habits were like planting seeds of heart disease.
meanings.sent5: The atherogenic smokestacks polluted the air with heart risks.

meanings.definition: Relating to substances or processes that contribute to the formation of atherosclerosis.
meanings.sent1: The atherogenic medication aimed to reduce plaque buildup in the arteries.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the atherogenic properties of certain fats.
meanings.sent3: The atherogenic dance moves of the robot entertained the crowd.
meanings.sent4: His atherogenic speech was like spreading cholesterol in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The atherogenic factory emitted toxins that accelerated artery damage.
